I should note that I am using JUnit 3.8.1 (have not had a reason to
switch =
to 4.x yet).  I have also verified that org.w3c.dom.* and
org.xml.sax.* app=
ear in my excluded.properties.

Andy

All,

 

I am currently testi=
ng a project by executing TestCase classes using an
ant JUnit task.  One te=
st case class makes use of JaxRPC and requires
XercesImpl.jar for execution=
.  When I add XercesImpl.jar to the running
classpath, I receive the follow=
ing exception during test execution (I
apologize for the long stack trace, =
but I wanted to get the meat of it
in there - it's at the bottom of this me=
ssage).  The java process
executing the tasks hangs after printing this sta=
ck trace and never
seems to return.

 

I have ensure that the xercesImpl.j=
ar within ant's lib directory matches
the one in my classpath (I copied it =
over my existing JAR).  I've also
tried adding ant's version to the running=
 classpath.  The fact that
there are two copies of the JAR does not seem to=
 be the problem.
